Class Check

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, com.guidewire.pl.persistence.core.BeanMethods, Editable, EFTDataDelegate, EventAware, Extractable, KeyableBean, Retireable, Versionable, CancelCheckMethods, CheckMethods, CheckValidationMethods, DeleteCheckMethods, Bean, BundleProvider, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>

    @Generated(value="com.guidewire.pl.metadata.codegen.Codegen",
           comments="Check.eti;Check.eix;Check.etx")
public class Check
extends com.guidewire.pl.persistence.code.BeanBase
implements Retireable, Extractable, EFTDataDelegate, EventAware, CancelCheckMethods, CheckMethods, CheckValidationMethods, DeleteCheckMethods
    Check A paper Check or EFT issued to a particular payee to deliver one or more Payments. A Check can have multiple payees, in which case distinct Checks to each secondary payee are created in the same CheckSet, and they are all related to the primary check as members of a CheckGroup. For a single payee check, the check's amount is the aggregate of all the payments associated with it. For a multiple-payee check, each of the secondary checks gets a portion of the aggregated payments, and the remainder is the amount of the primary Check.

      • acknowledgeSubmission

        public void acknowledgeSubmission()
        Acknowledges a message that this check is being submitted. Updates the check's status to REQUESTED if it was REQUESTING, or ISSUED if it was NOTIFYING. Updates its payments and their offsetting reserves (if any) to SUBMITTED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this check is not in REQUESTING or NOTIFYING status

      • acknowledgeTransfer

        public void acknowledgeTransfer()
        Acknowledges a message that this check is being transferred. Updates the check's status to TRANSFERRED. Updates its PENDINGTRANSFER payments to TRANSFERRED. For each transferred payment, updates its onset and offset to SUBMITTED. At the end it logs the transfer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this check is not in PENDINGTRANSFER status

      • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        public void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(java.math.BigDecimal newClaimAmount)
        Adjusts this check's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amounts of the payments to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared.Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. In this variant of the method, only a claim amount is specified, and an adjustment to the reporting amount is selected automatically. For example, if the reporting currency equals the transaction currency, then the reporting amount is not adjusted. If the payment's claim is in the reporting currency, then the reporting amount is adjusted to newClaimAmount. Otherwise, the adjusted reporting amount is determined by converting newClaimAmount to the reporting currency using this payment's claim-to-reporting exchange rate. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the check must:
        • have already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
        • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
        Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
        Parameters:
        newClaimAmount - the adjusted amount for this payment in the claim currency; cannot be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if claim amount is being adjusted but the transaction currency equals the claim currency

      • applyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        public void applyForeignExchangeAdjustment(java.math.BigDecimal newClaimAmount,
                                           java.math.BigDecimal newReportingAmount)
        Adjusts this check's claim and/or reporting amounts to the specified values. Such adjustments are intended for cases where better values for the amounts are determined later, after the check is created and escalated. For example, if a check is written from a claim-currency bank account, the amount actually deducted from that account's balance will be determined by exchange rates in effect at the time the check clears. This method allows, for example, the claim amounts of the payments to be adjusted to reflect that amount for which the check actually cleared. Null may be passed for newClaimAmount or newReportingAmount, in which case no adjustment is made to that amount. Adjustments are distributed proportionally among the payment's line items. For example, if the payment has four line items with claim amounts of $40, $20, $10, and $10 (a total of $80), and newClaimAmount is $100, then the claim amounts will be adjused to $50, $25, $12.50, and $12.50. In this example, each claim amount was increased by 25% (equal to the total relative increase), and each new claim amount comprises the same fraction of the total as it did before the adjustment. Adjustments to the claim and reporting amounts are largely independent. When this method is called, the system must be configured in multicurrency mode and the check must:
        • have already been escalated and sent downstream but not been canceled or transferred
        • not be part of a multi-payee (grouped) check
        Foreign exchange adjustments only affect total incurred and total paid calculations. They do not further erode reserves.
        Parameters:
        newClaimAmount - the value to which this check's claim amount should be adjusted; if null, the claim amount is not adjusted
        newReportingAmount - the value to which this check's reporting amount should be adjusted; if null, the reporting amount is not adjusted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is a conflict between the new, adjusted amounts and the currencies: if newClaimAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the transaction and claim currencies are the same, or if newClaimAmount is different from newReportingAmount and the reporting and claim currencies are the same, or if newReportingAmount is different from the current transaction amount and the reporting and transaction currencies are the same

      • canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment

        public boolean canApplyForeignExchangeAdjustment()
        Tests whether a foreign exchange adjustment can be applied to this check. Only checks that have been escalated (i.e., submitted to the downstream system), but not subsequently voided, stopped or transferred can have a foreign exchange adjustment applied to them. Also, foreign exchange adjustments are not allowed for multi-payee checks in version 5.0.x (joint-payee checks are OK) or if the system is not configured for multicurrency mode.
        Returns:
        true if this check can have a foreign exchange adjustment applied to it, else false

      • cloneCheck

        public Check cloneCheck()
        Creates a clone of this check in a new CheckSet. The new check can be modified, but prepareForCommit() must be called on its CheckSet before committing. A check cannot be cloned if it is part of a bulk invoice, is part of a recurrence, has been transferred, or is not a primary check. If this check is the primary check of a CheckGroup, the group is cloned and the new primary check is returned. All deductible line items are removed, so the total amount of the check may be greater than the original.
        Returns:
        clone of this check

        public void computeDeductions()

        Invokes any deduction adapters in the system to generate deductions for a check and adds them to the Check. All existing deductions on the Check are replaced.
        Throws:
        DeductionAdapterException - if the configured deduction adapter fails

      • coreCreateCheckForReissue

        public Check coreCreateCheckForReissue()
        NOTE: To create a check for reissuance, call createCheckForReissue() instead. This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

        Returns a copy of this check for reissuance without all of its fields completely initialized, since it is expected that createCheckForReissue() will finish initializing the object. The new check's status is set to TransactionStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION. If this is a primary check, the returned check will be a secondary check (since it won't have any payments yet) and when voidAndReissue(entity.Check) or stopAndReissue(entity.Check) is eventually called, the checks will swap roles: the old check will become a secondary check, the new check will become the primary check, and the payments and deductions will be moved to the new check.

        Returns:
        a new Check bean that is a copy of this check for purposes of reissuance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the check is not reissuable (i.e., if Check.Reissuable evaluates to false)

      • coreDelete

        public void coreDelete()
                throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Deletes a check and all of its payments and deductions via Check.retire(). For recurring CheckSets, if the primary check becomes null, then resets it to the first check in the recurrence and resets Recurrence.NumChecks if necessary. The method then calls CheckSet.delete().
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - If the current user does not have the required system permission for deleting checks.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the check does not have a valid status to be deleted.

      • coreStopAndReissue

        public void coreStopAndReissue(Check oldCheck)
        NOTE: To stop and reissue a check, call stopAndReissue(entity.Check). This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

        Performs the "core" operations to stop payment on and reissue one Check in a CheckGroup. Each Check in a CheckGroup represents one payee (or set of joint payees)--and therefore one physical check--for a multi-payee "check". The original Check, which is being reissued, is identified by the oldCheck argument, and this (the new Check) becomes its replacement. This check should have been returned by an earlier call to createCheckForReissue(). This method requires that the following criteria are met:

        • The user has the "stop" permission.
        • The original Check is Reissuable and has one of these statuses:
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTING
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_NOTIFYING
        The status of the original Check is set to TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGSTOP, and then reissuance proceeds as follows:
        1. If the original Check was the primary Check for the CheckGroup, the new Check becomes the primary Check and the original Check is converted to a secondary Check (still in the same CheckGroup), and all of the Payments and Deductions are moved to the new Check
        2. Regardless of whether the original Check already had a CheckPortion, a new, fixed-amount CheckPortion is created for it so that, in case it was not already defined by a fixed portion, its amount will not fluctuate (e.g., if it previously used a percentage portion)
        3. A CheckRpt is created for the new Check
        4. On the new Check, CheckNumber and IssueDate are cleared, ScheduledSendDate is set to today, and Status is is set to TransactionStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the allowed statuses or if the check is otherwise not reissuable

      • coreStopCheck

        public void coreStopCheck()
        NOTE: To stop a check, call stopCheck(). This should only be called from the implementation of that method. Performs the "core" operations to stop payment on a check. Offsetting reserves are created only if the payment is not a supplement (since supplement payments never affect open reserves in the first place) and either of the following holds: - the payment's exposure is closed (open reserves should always be zero for a closed exposure) - the open reserves for the payment's exposure's costtype is zero Offsetting reserves are included in this check's CheckSet.

        The status of the check and all payments on the check are set to pending stop. The status of any offsetting reserves is set to pending submission.

        If this check belongs to a CheckGroup, then all checks in the group are stopped.

        This action does not require approval.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING, TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED

      • coreVoidAndReissue

        public void coreVoidAndReissue(Check oldCheck)
        NOTE: To void and reissue a check, call voidAndReissue(entity.Check). This should only be called from the implementation of that method.

        Performs the "core" operations to void and reissue one Check in a CheckGroup. Each Check in a CheckGroup represents one payee (or set of joint payees)--and therefore one physical check--for a multi-payee "check". The original Check, which is being reissued, is identified by the oldCheck argument, and this (the new Check) becomes its replacement. This check should have been returned by an earlier call to createCheckForReissue(). This method requires that the following criteria are met:

        • The user has the "void" permission.
        • If the original Check was cleared, the user has the "voidclearedpmt" permission.
        • The original Check is Reissuable and has one of these statuses:
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTING
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_NOTIFYING
          • TransactionStatus#TC_CLEARED
        The status of the original Check is set to TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGVOID, and then reissuance proceeds as follows:
        1. If the original Check was the primary Check for the CheckGroup, the new Check becomes the primary Check and the original Check is converted to a secondary Check (still in the same CheckGroup), and all of the Payments and Deductions are moved to the new Check
        2. Regardless of whether the original Check already had a CheckPortion, a new, fixed-amount CheckPortion is created for it so that, in case it was not already defined by a fixed portion, its amount will not fluctuate (e.g., if it previously used a percentage portion)
        3. A CheckRpt is created for the new Check
        4. On the new Check, CheckNumber and IssueDate are cleared, ScheduledSendDate is set to today, and Status is is set to TransactionStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the allowed statuses or if the check is otherwise not reissuable

      • coreVoidCheck

        public void coreVoidCheck()
        NOTE: To void a check, call voidCheck(). This should only be called from the implementation of that method. Performs the "core" operations to void a check. This method will normally only be called from voidCheck(). Offsetting reserves are created only if the payment is not a supplement (since supplement payments never affect open reserves in the first place) and either of the following holds: - the payment's exposure is closed (open reserves should always be zero for a closed exposure) - the open reserves for the payment's exposure's costtype is zero Offsetting reserves are included in this check's CheckSet.

        The status of the check and all payments on the check are set to pending void. The status of any offsetting reserves is set to submitting.

        If this check belongs to a CheckGroup, then all checks in the group are voided.

        This action does not require approval.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if check status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTING, TransactionStatus.TC_REQUESTED, TransactionStatus.TC_ISSUED, TransactionStatus.TC_NOTIFYING, TransactionStatus.TC_CLEARED

      • createCheckForTransfer

        public Check createCheckForTransfer()
        Creates a new check that is a copy of this check. Also copies the payments, deductions, and payees of this check to the new check as new objects.

        Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

        1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
        2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
        3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
        Returns:
        A new Check that is a copy of this check for the purpose of transferring the original check to a new claim.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the bundle of this check is not writeable

      • executePayeeEarlyValidation

        public void executePayeeEarlyValidation()

      • executeRequiredPayeeEarlyValidation

        public void executeRequiredPayeeEarlyValidation()
        Validates the check payees for every check in the checkset being edited. Throws a UserDisplayableException with relevant error message if a problem is found.

      • executeRequiredPaymentEarlyValidation

        public void executeRequiredPaymentEarlyValidation()
        Verifies that each payment has a reserve line, a payment type, at least one line item, and that each line item has an amount. If problems are found during this verification, then a UserDisplayableException is thrown containing an appropriate error message.

      • findClaimant

        public Contact findClaimant()
        Returns the claimant that should be associated with this check.

      • findOrCreatePayment

        public Payment findOrCreatePayment()
        Get a payment on the check. If no payments exist, then one will be created and added to the Payments array.

        Warning: The payment returned can change from one call to the next. Used where the Check is guaranteed to have only one payment, or to edit fields which will immediately be synchronized across all Payments, such as Currency and exchange rate. Use with caution.

        Warning: call this method only on a Primary check. This method throws on a secondary check.

      • getSuggestedPayeeType

        public ContactRole getSuggestedPayeeType(Contact payee)
        Return the suggested Payee type for the given Payee. Used in UI reflection to pre-fill a suggested Payee type if the user selects a particular Payee. A payee type is a contact role, but is restricted to be one of the roles given by the "payee" type filter. This method checks the given payee is a claim contact. If so it searches through the claim contact's roles for the first one (in typekey order - priority/name) that is allowed by the "payee" type filter. If it finds such a role it returns that. If the contact is not a claim contact or it has no suitable role then this method returns "vendor" if the contact is a vendor and "other" otherwise. If the payee argument is null this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        payee - the payee contact for which to suggest a payee type
        Returns:
        the suggested payee type, or null if no suggestion can be found

      • isDeletable

        public boolean isDeletable()
        Tests whether the check can be deleted. For the check to be deletable it must have one of the following statuses:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_DRAFT
        • TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGAPPROVAL
        • TransactionStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REJECTED
        • TransactionStatus#TC_DENIED
        If the check is part of a group (i.e., the check was created with one or more secondary payees), then every check in the group must be deletable for this check to be deletable.
        Returns:
        true if this check can be deleted, else false

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        Tests whether this check can be edited. For the check to be editable, it must have one of the following statuses:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_DRAFT
        • TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGAPPROVAL
        • TransactionStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REJECTED
        Returns:
        true if this check can be edited, else false

        public boolean isGroupMember(boolean acceptSingleMemberGroups)
        Tests whether this check belongs to a CheckGroup (optionally, the number of CheckGroup members is considered as well).
        Parameters:
        acceptSingleMemberGroups - if true, method will return true even if this check is the only member of the CheckGroup, otherwise if false and this check is only member of the group, will return false.
        Returns:
        true if this check is a member of a CheckGroup, accounting for the passed parameter, else false

        isRetired in interface Retireable

      • isScheduledSendDateInFuture

      • isStoppable

        public boolean isStoppable()
        True if a stop payment can be issued against this check. The check status must be one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTING
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTED
        • TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED
        • TransactionStatus#TC_NOTIFYING
        If this check belongs to a check group, then all others checks in the group must be stoppable or already voided/stopped.
        Returns:
        true if this check can be stopped, else false

      • isStoppableForReissue

        public boolean isStoppableForReissue()
        Tests whether this check can be stopped and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isStoppable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.
        Returns:
        true if this check can be stopped and reissued, else false

      • isStopped

        public boolean isStopped()
        Returns true if the status indicates the check has been stopped. Specifically, if the status is one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGSTOP
        • TransactionStatus#TC_STOPPED

      • isTransferable

        public boolean isTransferable()
        Tests whether this check can be transferred to another claim. This check is transferable if the following are true:
        • it is not a recurring check
        • it does not belong to a check group
        • its status is one of the following:
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTING
          • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_NOTIFYING
          • TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED
          • TransactionStatus#TC_CLEARED
        Returns:
        true if this check can be transferred to a new claim, else false

      • isTransferred

        public boolean isTransferred()
        Tests whether this check has been transferred to another claim. That is, its status is one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGTRANSFER
        • TransactionStatus#TC_TRANSFERRED
        Returns:
        true if this check has been transferred, else false

      • isVoidable

        public boolean isVoidable()
        True if this check is can be voided. The check status must be one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTING
        • TransactionStatus#TC_REQUESTED
        • TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED
        • TransactionStatus#TC_NOTIFYING
        • TransactionStatus#TC_CLEARED
        If this check belongs to a check group, then all others checks in the group must be voidable or already voided/stopped.
        Returns:
        true if this check can be voided, else false

      • isVoidableForReissue

        public boolean isVoidableForReissue()
        Tests whether this check can be voided and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isVoidable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.
        Returns:
        true if this check can be voided and reissued, else false

      • isVoided

        public boolean isVoided()
        Returns true if the status indicates the check has been voided. Specifically, if the status is one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus#TC_PENDINGVOID
        • TransactionStatus#TC_VOIDED

      • prepareForCommitForTransfer

        public java.util.List<ValidationExecutionResult> prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
        When transfering a Check in Gosu outside the UI, this is the final call to update the old and new Checks, including the updating of Taccounts. Before calling this method, a new ReserveLine on the target claim can be chosen/set for each payment of newCheck. After this method is called, the Payments on the old and new Checks cannot be modified.

        See also {CheckUtil#transferCheck( Check newCheck, Check oldCheck, Location currentLocation )} for use in the UI instead of this method.

        Note that any Final payments on the newCheck will attempt to close their target exposure or claim.

        Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

        1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
        2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
        3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
        Parameters:
        oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
        Returns:
        List of ValidationExecutionResult objects with any validation errors or warnings from the Claim or Exposure Closed Validation rules, resulting from any attempt to close the Exposure or Claim of Final payments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount or transaction statuses are changed.

      • refresh

        public KeyableBean refresh()
        Refreshes this bean with the latest database version.

        This method does nothing if the bean is edited or inserted in its current bundle. If the bean no longer exists in the database, then null is returned. If the bean has been evicted from its bundle, then null is returned. Otherwise, this bean is returned, with its contents updated.

        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface KeyableBean
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Versionable

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Marks this bean for remove. A bean marked for remove will be deleted or retired when the transaction is committed. Once a bean is marked for remove, it cannot be switched to update, edit, or read.

        WARNING: This method is designed for simple custom entities which are normally not associated with other entities. Undesirable results may occur when used on out-of-box entities.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        remove in interface KeyableBean
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Versionable

      • requestCheck

        public void requestCheck()
        Escalates the Check's status to Requesting. Which means the following:
        1. Check is moved to "requesting" status
        2. All Payments are moved to "submitting" unless they've already been submitted (I think this the case when a check is transferred?)
        3. Zeroing Reserves are created
        4. If configured to do so, an attempt is made to close the Exposure. If this fails, an activity is created saying the close was not possible and giving the validation errors.
        5. If the Exposure closes and it was the only open exposure, the claim is closed (if configured to close claim after final payment)
        6. Transaction post setup rules are executed on this transaction set because new Reserves may have been created
        7. A reminder activity is created if this check is the penultimate in a recurrence
        Returns without doing anything if the check is not in AWAITINGSUBMISSION state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the check is not scheduled to be sent today

      • resubmit

        public void resubmit()
              throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException

        Throws:

        public void setOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate(boolean value)
        Specifies whether the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate shall be overridden for the payments on this check. If changing from false to true, a new manual exchange rate is created. If changing from true to false, the manual exchange rate is discarded and replaced with the current market rate.

      • touch

        public void touch()
        Set's the version of the bean to the next value (i.e. the bean version original value+1) Multiple calls to this method on the same bean will result in the same value being used for the version (i.e. it is idempotent). Calling this method will force the bean to be written to the database and participate fully in the commit cycle e.g. pre-update rules will be run, etc.
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Versionable

      • updateCheckForTransfer

        public void updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim,
                                   Check oldCheck)
        Sets the claim of the payments, checkset, and claimcontacts of this check to the claim given. Also, for every payment:
        • Sets the exposure to the first matching exposure (by PrimaryCoverage and LossParty) on the given claim, if one exists. Otherwise, sets it to null.
        • Sets the ReserveLine to the best matching Reserve Line on the given claim. Otherwise, sets it to null.

        Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

        1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
        2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
        3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
        Parameters:
        newClaim - the claim to which this check is being transferred
        oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the original check id null

      • updateCheckForTransfer

        public void updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim,
                                   Check oldCheck,
                                   Currency targetReservingCurrency)
        Sets the claim of the payments, checkset, and claimcontacts of this check to the claim on this check. Also, for every payment:
        • Sets the exposure to the first matching exposure (by PrimaryCoverage and LossParty) on the given claim, if one exists. Otherwise, sets it to null.
        • Sets the ReserveLine to the best matching Reserve Line on the given claim. Otherwise, sets it to null. The targetReservingCurrency is included in the matching logic.

        Methods to call when Transferring a Check:

        1. oldCheck.createCheckForTransfer() - returns the newCheck
        2. newCheck.updateCheckForTransfer(Claim newClaim, Check oldCheck)
        3. CheckUtil#transferCheck( newCheck, oldCheck, Location currentLocation ) OR newCheck.prepareForCommitForTransfer(Check oldCheck)
        Parameters:
        newClaim - the claim to which this check is being transferred
        oldCheck - the original check object representing the check that is being transferred
        targetReservingCurrency - the Reserving Currency to be used for matching the payment Reserve Lines on the new Claim.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the original check id null

      • updateCheckStatus

        public void updateCheckStatus(java.lang.String checkNumber,
                              java.util.Calendar issueDate,
                              TransactionStatus status)
        Updates the status of a check.

        Allowed check status are "issued", "cleared", "voided", and "stopped". The "Issued" and "Cleared" statuses are not legal options if this check is part of a multi-payee check group that has been voided or stopped.

        If the check status is changed to "voided" or "stopped", the status of "pending void" or "pending stop" payments are updated as well.

        checkNumber and issueDate is used when updating the check status to "issued". For other updates, these two fields can be left as NULL.

        Note that if the check is pending stop or pending void and the new status is issued or cleared, the statuses of the check and its payments are updated and a warning activity is created and assigned to the user who attempted to void or stop the check so that the user knows that the check was not voided.

        If the Check is linked to a BulkInvoiceItem (check.Bulked == true), updating the Check status will also update the BulkInvoiceItem status, if appropriate.

        Parameters:
        checkNumber - the checkNumber to update to
        issueDate - the issueDate to updated to
        status - the status to update to
